description: Provides a description of the specified flow.

parameters.name: flowName
parameters.description: The specified name of the flow. Spaces are not allowed. Use underscores (_) or hyphens (-) only.

nested_items.name: flowArn
nested_items.description: The flow's Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: A description of the flow.

nested_items.name: flowName
nested_items.description: The specified name of the flow. Spaces are not allowed. Use underscores (_) or hyphens (-) only.

nested_items.name: kmsArn
nested_items.description: The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the Key Management Service (KMS) key you provide for encryption. This is required if you do not want to use the Amazon AppFlow-managed KMS key. If you don't provide anything here, Amazon AppFlow uses the Amazon AppFlow-managed KMS key.

nested_items.name: flowStatus
nested_items.description: Indicates the current status of the flow.

nested_items.name: flowStatusMessage
nested_items.description: Contains an error message if the flow status is in a suspended or error state. This applies only to scheduled or event-triggered flows.

nested_items.name: sourceFlowConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration that controls how Amazon AppFlow retrieves data from the source connector.

nested_items.name: connectorType
nested_items.description: The type of connector, such as Salesforce, Amplitude, and so on.

nested_items.name: apiVersion
nested_items.description: The API version of the connector when it's used as a source in the flow.

nested_items.name: connectorProfileName
nested_items.description: The name of the connector profile. This name must be unique for each connector profile in the Amazon Web Services account.

nested_items.name: sourceConnectorProperties
nested_items.description: Specifies the information that is required to query a particular source connector.

nested_items.name: Amplitude
nested_items.description: Specifies the information that is required for querying Amplitude.

nested_items.name: object
nested_items.description: The object specified in the Amplitude flow source.

nested_items.name: object
nested_items.description: The object specified in the Datadog flow source.

nested_items.name: Dynatrace
nested_items.description: Specifies the information that is required for querying Dynatrace.

nested_items.name: object
nested_items.description: The object specified in the Dynatrace flow source.

nested_items.name: GoogleAnalytics
nested_items.description: Specifies the information that is required for querying Google Analytics.

nested_items.name: object
nested_items.description: The object specified in the Google Analytics flow source.

nested_items.name: InforNexus
nested_items.description: Specifies the information that is required for querying Infor Nexus.

nested_items.name: object
nested_items.description: The object specified in the Infor Nexus flow source.

nested_items.name: object
nested_items.description: The object specified in the Marketo flow source.

nested_items.name: bucketName
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 bucket name where the source files are stored.

nested_items.name: bucketPrefix
nested_items.description: The object key for the Amazon S3 bucket in which the source files are stored.

nested_items.name: s3InputFormatConfig
nested_items.description: When you use Amazon S3 as the source, the configuration format that you provide the flow input data.

nested_items.name: s3InputFileType
nested_items.description: The file type that Amazon AppFlow gets from your Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: Salesforce
nested_items.description: Specifies the information that is required for querying Salesforce.

nested_items.name: object
nested_items.description: The object specified in the Salesforce flow source.

nested_items.name: enableDynamicFieldUpdate
nested_items.description: The flag that enables dynamic fetching of new (recently added) fields in the Salesforce objects while running a flow.

nested_items.name: includeDeletedRecords
nested_items.description: Indicates whether Amazon AppFlow includes deleted files in the flow run.

nested_items.name: dataTransferApi
nested_items.description: Specifies which Salesforce API is used by Amazon AppFlow when your flow transfers data from Salesforce.

nested_items.name: ServiceNow
nested_items.description: Specifies the information that is required for querying ServiceNow.

nested_items.name: object
nested_items.description: The object specified in the ServiceNow flow source.

nested_items.name: object
nested_items.description: The object specified in the Singular flow source.

nested_items.name: object
nested_items.description: The object specified in the Slack flow source.

nested_items.name: Trendmicro
nested_items.description: Specifies the information that is required for querying Trend Micro.

nested_items.name: object
nested_items.description: The object specified in the Trend Micro flow source.

nested_items.name: object
nested_items.description: The object specified in the Veeva flow source.

nested_items.name: documentType
nested_items.description: The document type specified in the Veeva document extract flow.

nested_items.name: includeSourceFiles
nested_items.description: Boolean value to include source files in Veeva document extract flow.

nested_items.name: includeRenditions
nested_items.description: Boolean value to include file renditions in Veeva document extract flow.

nested_items.name: includeAllVersions
nested_items.description: Boolean value to include All Versions of files in Veeva document extract flow.

nested_items.name: object
nested_items.description: The object specified in the Zendesk flow source.

nested_items.name: objectPath
nested_items.description: The object path specified in the SAPOData flow source.

nested_items.name: parallelismConfig
nested_items.description: Sets the number of concurrent processes that transfers OData records from your SAP instance.

nested_items.name: maxParallelism
nested_items.description: The maximum number of processes that Amazon AppFlow runs at the same time when it retrieves your data from your SAP application.

nested_items.name: paginationConfig
nested_items.description: Sets the page size for each concurrent process that transfers OData records from your SAP instance.

nested_items.name: maxPageSize
nested_items.description: The maximum number of records that Amazon AppFlow receives in each page of the response from your SAP application. For transfers of OData records, the maximum page size is 3,000. For transfers of data that comes from an ODP provider, the maximum page size is 10,000.

nested_items.name: CustomConnector
nested_items.description: The properties that are applied when the custom connector is being used as a source.

nested_items.name: entityName
nested_items.description: The entity specified in the custom connector as a source in the flow.

nested_items.name: customProperties
nested_items.description: Custom properties that are required to use the custom connector as a source.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: dataTransferApi
nested_items.description: The API of the connector application that Amazon AppFlow uses to transfer your data.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the connector application API.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: You can specify one of the following types:

nested_items.name: object
nested_items.description: The object specified in the Salesforce Pardot flow source.

nested_items.name: incrementalPullConfig
nested_items.description: Defines the configuration for a scheduled incremental data pull. If a valid configuration is provided, the fields specified in the configuration are used when querying for the incremental data pull.

nested_items.name: datetimeTypeFieldName
nested_items.description: A field that specifies the date time or timestamp field as the criteria to use when importing incremental records from the source.

nested_items.name: destinationFlowConfigList
nested_items.description: The configuration that controls how Amazon AppFlow transfers data to the destination connector.

nested_items.name: connectorType
nested_items.description: The type of connector, such as Salesforce, Amplitude, and so on.

nested_items.name: apiVersion
nested_items.description: The API version that the destination connector uses.

nested_items.name: connectorProfileName
nested_items.description: The name of the connector profile. This name must be unique for each connector profile in the Amazon Web Services account.

nested_items.name: destinationConnectorProperties
nested_items.description: This stores the information that is required to query a particular connector.

nested_items.name: object
nested_items.description: The object specified in the Amazon Redshift flow destination.

nested_items.name: intermediateBucketName
nested_items.description: The intermediate bucket that Amazon AppFlow uses when moving data into Amazon Redshift.

nested_items.name: bucketPrefix
nested_items.description: The object key for the bucket in which Amazon AppFlow places the destination files.

nested_items.name: errorHandlingConfig
nested_items.description: The settings that determine how Amazon AppFlow handles an error when placing data in the Amazon Redshift destination. For example, this setting would determine if the flow should fail after one insertion error, or continue and attempt to insert every record regardless of the initial failure. ErrorHandlingConfig is a part of the destination connector details.

nested_items.name: failOnFirstDestinationError
nested_items.description: Specifies if the flow should fail after the first instance of a failure when attempting to place data in the destination.

nested_items.name: bucketPrefix
nested_items.description: Specifies the Amazon S3 bucket prefix.

nested_items.name: bucketName
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: bucketName
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 bucket name in which Amazon AppFlow places the transferred data.

nested_items.name: bucketPrefix
nested_items.description: The object key for the destination bucket in which Amazon AppFlow places the files.

nested_items.name: s3OutputFormatConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration that determines how Amazon AppFlow should format the flow output data when Amazon S3 is used as the destination.

nested_items.name: fileType
nested_items.description: Indicates the file type that Amazon AppFlow places in the Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: prefixConfig
nested_items.description: Determines the prefix that Amazon AppFlow applies to the folder name in the Amazon S3 bucket. You can name folders according to the flow frequency and date.

nested_items.name: prefixType
nested_items.description: Determines the format of the prefix, and whether it applies to the file name, file path, or both.

nested_items.name: prefixFormat
nested_items.description: Determines the level of granularity for the date and time that's included in the prefix.

nested_items.name: pathPrefixHierarchy
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the destination file path includes either or both of the following elements:
Source-to-destination field mappings.
Field data types.
Partition keys.

nested_items.name: aggregationConfig
nested_items.description: The aggregation settings that you can use to customize the output format of your flow data.

nested_items.name: aggregationType
nested_items.description: Specifies whether Amazon AppFlow aggregates the flow records into a single file, or leave them unaggregated.

nested_items.name: targetFileSize
nested_items.description: The desired file size, in MB, for each output file that Amazon AppFlow writes to the flow destination. For each file, Amazon AppFlow attempts to achieve the size that you specify. The actual file sizes might differ from this target based on the number and size of the records that each file contains.

nested_items.name: preserveSourceDataTyping
nested_items.description: If your file output format is Parquet, use this parameter to set whether Amazon AppFlow preserves the data types in your source data when it writes the output to Amazon S3.
true: Amazon AppFlow preserves the data types when it writes to Amazon S3. For example, an integer or 1 in your source data is still an integer in your output.
false: Amazon AppFlow converts all of the source data into strings when it writes to Amazon S3. For example, an integer of 1 in your source data becomes the string "1" in the output.

nested_items.name: Salesforce
nested_items.description: The properties required to query Salesforce.

nested_items.name: object
nested_items.description: The object specified in the Salesforce flow destination.

nested_items.name: idFieldNames
nested_items.description: The name of the field that Amazon AppFlow uses as an ID when performing a write operation such as update or delete.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: errorHandlingConfig
nested_items.description: The settings that determine how Amazon AppFlow handles an error when placing data in the Salesforce destination. For example, this setting would determine if the flow should fail after one insertion error, or continue and attempt to insert every record regardless of the initial failure. ErrorHandlingConfig is a part of the destination connector details.

nested_items.name: failOnFirstDestinationError
nested_items.description: Specifies if the flow should fail after the first instance of a failure when attempting to place data in the destination.

nested_items.name: bucketPrefix
nested_items.description: Specifies the Amazon S3 bucket prefix.

nested_items.name: bucketName
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: writeOperationType
nested_items.description: This specifies the type of write operation to be performed in Salesforce. When the value is UPSERT, then idFieldNames is required.

nested_items.name: dataTransferApi
nested_items.description: Specifies which Salesforce API is used by Amazon AppFlow when your flow transfers data to Salesforce.

nested_items.name: Snowflake
nested_items.description: The properties required to query Snowflake.

nested_items.name: object

nested_items.name: intermediateBucketName
nested_items.description: The intermediate bucket that Amazon AppFlow uses when moving data into Snowflake.

nested_items.name: bucketPrefix
nested_items.description: The object key for the destination bucket in which Amazon AppFlow places the files.

nested_items.name: errorHandlingConfig
nested_items.description: The settings that determine how Amazon AppFlow handles an error when placing data in the Snowflake destination. For example, this setting would determine if the flow should fail after one insertion error, or continue and attempt to insert every record regardless of the initial failure. ErrorHandlingConfig is a part of the destination connector details.

nested_items.name: failOnFirstDestinationError
nested_items.description: Specifies if the flow should fail after the first instance of a failure when attempting to place data in the destination.

nested_items.name: bucketPrefix
nested_items.description: Specifies the Amazon S3 bucket prefix.

nested_items.name: bucketName
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: EventBridge
nested_items.description: The properties required to query Amazon EventBridge.

nested_items.name: object
nested_items.description: The object specified in the Amazon EventBridge flow destination.

nested_items.name: errorHandlingConfig
nested_items.description: The settings that determine how Amazon AppFlow handles an error when placing data in the destination. For example, this setting would determine if the flow should fail after one insertion error, or continue and attempt to insert every record regardless of the initial failure. ErrorHandlingConfig is a part of the destination connector details.

nested_items.name: failOnFirstDestinationError
nested_items.description: Specifies if the flow should fail after the first instance of a failure when attempting to place data in the destination.

nested_items.name: bucketPrefix
nested_items.description: Specifies the Amazon S3 bucket prefix.

nested_items.name: bucketName
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: LookoutMetrics
nested_items.description: The properties required to query Amazon Lookout for Metrics.

nested_items.name: bucketName
nested_items.description: The Upsolver Amazon S3 bucket name in which Amazon AppFlow places the transferred data.

nested_items.name: bucketPrefix
nested_items.description: The object key for the destination Upsolver Amazon S3 bucket in which Amazon AppFlow places the files.

nested_items.name: s3OutputFormatConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration that determines how data is formatted when Upsolver is used as the flow destination.

nested_items.name: fileType
nested_items.description: Indicates the file type that Amazon AppFlow places in the Upsolver Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: prefixConfig
nested_items.description: Specifies elements that Amazon AppFlow includes in the file and folder names in the flow destination.

nested_items.name: prefixType
nested_items.description: Determines the format of the prefix, and whether it applies to the file name, file path, or both.

nested_items.name: prefixFormat
nested_items.description: Determines the level of granularity for the date and time that's included in the prefix.

nested_items.name: pathPrefixHierarchy
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the destination file path includes either or both of the following elements:
Source-to-destination field mappings.
Field data types.
Partition keys.

nested_items.name: aggregationConfig
nested_items.description: The aggregation settings that you can use to customize the output format of your flow data.

nested_items.name: aggregationType
nested_items.description: Specifies whether Amazon AppFlow aggregates the flow records into a single file, or leave them unaggregated.

nested_items.name: targetFileSize
nested_items.description: The desired file size, in MB, for each output file that Amazon AppFlow writes to the flow destination. For each file, Amazon AppFlow attempts to achieve the size that you specify. The actual file sizes might differ from this target based on the number and size of the records that each file contains.

nested_items.description: The properties required to query Amazon Honeycode.

nested_items.description: The object specified in the Amazon Connect Customer Profiles flow destination.

nested_items.description: The object specified in the Zendesk flow destination.

nested_items.name: idFieldNames
nested_items.description: A list of field names that can be used as an ID field when performing a write operation.

For example, this setting would determine if the flow should fail after one insertion error, or continue and attempt to insert every record regardless of the initial failure. ErrorHandlingConfig is a part of the destination connector details.

nested_items.name: failOnFirstDestinationError
nested_items.description: Specifies if the flow should fail after the first instance of a failure when attempting to place data in the destination.

nested_items.name: bucketPrefix
nested_items.description: Specifies the Amazon S3 bucket prefix.

nested_items.name: bucketName
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: writeOperationType
nested_items.description: The possible write operations in the destination connector. When this value is not provided, this defaults to the INSERT operation.

nested_items.description: The settings that determine how Amazon AppFlow handles an error when placing data in the destination. For example, this setting would determine if the flow should fail after one insertion error, or continue and attempt to insert every record regardless of the initial failure. ErrorHandlingConfig is a part of the destination connector details.

nested_items.description: Specifies if the flow should fail after the first instance of a failure when attempting to place data in the destination.

nested_items.name: bucketName
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: CustomConnector
nested_items.description: The properties that are required to query the custom Connector.

nested_items.name: entityName
nested_items.description: The entity specified in the custom connector as a destination in the flow.

nested_items.name: errorHandlingConfig
nested_items.description: The settings that determine how Amazon AppFlow handles an error when placing data in the custom connector as destination.

nested_items.name: failOnFirstDestinationError
nested_items.description: Specifies if the flow should fail after the first instance of a failure when attempting to place data in the destination.

nested_items.name: bucketPrefix
nested_items.description: Specifies the Amazon S3 bucket prefix.

nested_items.name: bucketName
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: writeOperationType
nested_items.description: Specifies the type of write operation to be performed in the custom connector when it's used as destination.

nested_items.name: idFieldNames
nested_items.description: The name of the field that Amazon AppFlow uses as an ID when performing a write operation such as update, delete, or upsert.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: customProperties
nested_items.description: The custom properties that are specific to the connector when it's used as a destination in the flow.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: objectPath
nested_items.description: The object path specified in the SAPOData flow destination.

nested_items.name: successResponseHandlingConfig
nested_items.description: Determines how Amazon AppFlow handles the success response that it gets from the connector after placing data.

nested_items.name: bucketPrefix
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 bucket prefix.

nested_items.name: bucketName
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: idFieldNames
nested_items.description: A list of field names that can be used as an ID field when performing a write operation.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: errorHandlingConfig
nested_items.description: The settings that determine how Amazon AppFlow handles an error when placing data in the destination. For example, this setting would determine if the flow should fail after one insertion error, or continue and attempt to insert every record regardless of the initial failure. ErrorHandlingConfig is a part of the destination connector details.

nested_items.name: failOnFirstDestinationError
nested_items.description: Specifies if the flow should fail after the first instance of a failure when attempting to place data in the destination.

nested_items.name: bucketPrefix
nested_items.description: Specifies the Amazon S3 bucket prefix.

nested_items.name: bucketName
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: writeOperationType
nested_items.description: The possible write operations in the destination connector. When this value is not provided, this defaults to the INSERT operation.

nested_items.name: lastRunExecutionDetails
nested_items.description: Describes the details of the most recent flow run.

nested_items.name: mostRecentExecutionMessage
nested_items.description: Describes the details of the most recent flow run.

nested_items.name: mostRecentExecutionTime
nested_items.description: Specifies the time of the most recent flow run.

nested_items.name: mostRecentExecutionStatus
nested_items.description: Specifies the status of the most recent flow run.

nested_items.name: triggerConfig
nested_items.description: The trigger settings that determine how and when the flow runs.

nested_items.name: triggerType
nested_items.description: Specifies the type of flow trigger. This can be OnDemand, Scheduled, or Event.

nested_items.name: triggerProperties
nested_items.description: Specifies the configuration details of a schedule-triggered flow as defined by the user. Currently, these settings only apply to the Scheduled trigger type.

nested_items.name: Scheduled
nested_items.description: Specifies the configuration details of a schedule-triggered flow as defined by the user.

nested_items.name: scheduleExpression
nested_items.description: The scheduling expression that determines the rate at which the schedule will run, for example rate(5minutes).

nested_items.name: dataPullMode
nested_items.description: Specifies whether a scheduled flow has an incremental data transfer or a complete data transfer for each flow run.

nested_items.name: scheduleStartTime
nested_items.description: The time at which the scheduled flow starts. The time is formatted as a timestamp that follows the ISO 8601 standard, such as 2022-04-26T13:00:00-07:00.

nested_items.name: scheduleEndTime
nested_items.description: The time at which the scheduled flow ends. The time is formatted as a timestamp that follows the ISO 8601 standard, such as 2022-04-27T13:00:00-07:00.

nested_items.name: timezone
nested_items.description: Specifies the time zone used when referring to the dates and times of a scheduled flow, such as America/New_York. This time zone is only a descriptive label. It doesn't affect how Amazon AppFlow interprets the timestamps that you specify to schedule the flow.

nested_items.name: scheduleOffset
nested_items.description: Specifies the optional offset that is added to the time interval for a schedule-triggered flow.

nested_items.name: firstExecutionFrom
nested_items.description: Specifies the date range for the records to import from the connector in the first flow run.

nested_items.name: flowErrorDeactivationThreshold
nested_items.description: Defines how many times a scheduled flow fails consecutively before Amazon AppFlow deactivates it.

nested_items.name: tasks
nested_items.description: A list of tasks that Amazon AppFlow performs while transferring the data in the flow run.

nested_items.name: sourceFields
nested_items.description: The source fields to which a particular task is applied.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: connectorOperator
nested_items.description: The operation to be performed on the provided source fields.

nested_items.name: Amplitude
nested_items.description: The operation to be performed on the provided Amplitude source fields.

nested_items.name: Datadog
nested_items.description: The operation to be performed on the provided Datadog source fields.

nested_items.name: Dynatrace
nested_items.description: The operation to be performed on the provided Dynatrace source fields.

nested_items.name: GoogleAnalytics
nested_items.description: The operation to be performed on the provided Google Analytics source fields.

nested_items.name: InforNexus
nested_items.description: The operation to be performed on the provided Infor Nexus source fields.

nested_items.name: Marketo
nested_items.description: The operation to be performed on the provided Marketo source fields.

nested_items.name: S3
nested_items.description: The operation to be performed on the provided Amazon S3 source fields.

nested_items.name: Salesforce
nested_items.description: The operation to be performed on the provided Salesforce source fields.

nested_items.name: ServiceNow
nested_items.description: The operation to be performed on the provided ServiceNow source fields.

nested_items.name: Singular
nested_items.description: The operation to be performed on the provided Singular source fields.

nested_items.name: Slack
nested_items.description: The operation to be performed on the provided Slack source fields.

nested_items.name: Trendmicro
nested_items.description: The operation to be performed on the provided Trend Micro source fields.

nested_items.name: Veeva
nested_items.description: The operation to be performed on the provided Veeva source fields.

nested_items.name: Zendesk
nested_items.description: The operation to be performed on the provided Zendesk source fields.

nested_items.name: SAPOData
nested_items.description: The operation to be performed on the provided SAPOData source fields.

nested_items.name: CustomConnector
nested_items.description: Operators supported by the custom connector.

nested_items.name: Pardot
nested_items.description: The operation to be performed on the provided Salesforce Pardot source fields.

nested_items.name: destinationField
nested_items.description: A field in a destination connector, or a field value against which Amazon AppFlow validates a source field.

nested_items.name: taskType
nested_items.description: Specifies the particular task implementation that Amazon AppFlow performs.

nested_items.name: taskProperties
nested_items.description: A map used to store task-related information. The execution service looks for particular information based on the TaskType.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: Specifies when the flow was created.

nested_items.name: lastUpdatedAt
nested_items.description: Specifies when the flow was last updated.

nested_items.name: createdBy
nested_items.description: The ARN of the user who created the flow.

nested_items.name: lastUpdatedBy
nested_items.description: Specifies the user name of the account that performed the most recent update.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: metadataCatalogConfig
nested_items.description: Specifies the configuration that Amazon AppFlow uses when it catalogs the data that's transferred by the associated flow. When Amazon AppFlow catalogs the data from a flow, it stores metadata in a data catalog.

nested_items.name: glueDataCatalog
nested_items.description: Specifies the configuration that Amazon AppFlow uses when it catalogs your data with the Glue Data Catalog.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that grants Amazon AppFlow the permissions it needs to create Data Catalog tables, databases, and partitions.

nested_items.name: databaseName
nested_items.description: The name of the Data Catalog database that stores the metadata tables that Amazon AppFlow creates in your Amazon Web Services account. These tables contain metadata for the data that's transferred by the flow that you configure with this parameter.

nested_items.name: tablePrefix
nested_items.description: A naming prefix for each Data Catalog table that Amazon AppFlow creates for the flow that you configure with this setting. Amazon AppFlow adds the prefix to the beginning of the each table name.

nested_items.name: lastRunMetadataCatalogDetails
nested_items.description: Describes the metadata catalog, metadata table, and data partitions that Amazon AppFlow used for the associated flow run.

nested_items.name: catalogType
nested_items.description: The type of metadata catalog that Amazon AppFlow used for the associated flow run. This parameter returns the following value:

nested_items.name: tableName
nested_items.description: The name of the table that stores the metadata for the associated flow run. The table stores metadata that represents the data that the flow transferred. Amazon AppFlow stores the table in the metadata catalog.

nested_items.name: tableRegistrationOutput
nested_items.description: Describes the status of the attempt from Amazon AppFlow to register the metadata table with the metadata catalog. Amazon AppFlow creates or updates this table for the associated flow run.

nested_items.name: message
nested_items.description: Explains the status of the registration attempt from Amazon AppFlow. If the attempt fails, the message explains why.

nested_items.name: result
nested_items.description: Indicates the number of resources that Amazon AppFlow created or updated. Possible resources include metadata tables and data partitions.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: Indicates the status of the registration attempt from Amazon AppFlow.

nested_items.name: partitionRegistrationOutput
nested_items.description: Describes the status of the attempt from Amazon AppFlow to register the data partitions with the metadata catalog. The data partitions organize the flow output into a hierarchical path, such as a folder path in an S3 bucket. Amazon AppFlow creates the partitions (if they don't already exist) based on your flow configuration.

nested_items.name: message
nested_items.description: Explains the status of the registration attempt from Amazon AppFlow. If the attempt fails, the message explains why.

nested_items.name: result
nested_items.description: Indicates the number of resources that Amazon AppFlow created or updated. Possible resources include metadata tables and data partitions.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: Indicates the status of the registration attempt from Amazon AppFlow.

nested_items.name: schemaVersion
nested_items.description: The version number of your data schema. Amazon AppFlow assigns this version number. The version number increases by one when you change any of the following settings in your flow configuration:
Source-to-destination field mappings.
Field data types.
Partition keys.
